Plotting

Plotter

Plotting using Ptoolkit requires the use of the Plotter() object

Plotter(seperator=',')

Plotting class containing the functions and settings to format a scientific looking figure

Parameters

seperator – The seperator the type used on the axis can be “.” or “,”.

Plotter.Config_plot_style()

Method to configure the plot style of Ptoolkit. This method is automaticly run when creating a Plotter object. If for any reason the style is gone run this command.

Axis formatting

Plotter.Decimal_format_axis(ax, decimalx=1, decimaly=1, decimalz=None, imaginary_axis='')

Method to format the axis of the plot using a decimal formatter

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – matplotlib axis object.

  • decimalx (int) – the amount of decimals used for each tick on the x-axis.

  • decimaly – the amount of decimals used for each tick on the y-axis.

  • decimalz – the amount of decimals used for each tick on the z-axis.

  • imaginary_axis (str) – string containing the axis that are imaginary

Plotter.Significant_figure_format_axis(ax, decimalx=1, decimaly=1, decimalz=None, imaginary_axis='')

Method to format the axis of the plot using a significant figure formatter

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – matplotlib axis object.

  • sigfigx – the amount of significant digits used for each tick on the x-axis.

  • sigfigy – the amount of significant digits for each tick on the y-axis.

  • sigfigz – the amount of significant digits for each tick on the z-axis.

  • imaginary_axis (str) – string containing the axis that are imaginary

Plotter.Set_xlabel(ax, physical_quantity, unit, tenpower=0)

Method to set the x label on given axis object. When using latex symbols it is required to add $$ only by the unit parameter.

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – matplotlib axis object.

  • physical_quantity (str) – The physical_quantity that needs to be placed on the x axis

  • unit (str) – The unit of the physical_quantity that needs to be placed on the x axis

  • tenpower (int) – The power for scientific notation if 0 scientific notation will not be used

Plotter.Set_ylabel(ax, physical_quantity, unit, tenpower=0)

Method to set the y label on given axis object. When using latex symbols it is required to add $$ only by the unit parameter.

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – matplotlib axis object.

  • physical_quantity (str) – The physical_quantity that needs to be placed on the y axis

  • unit (str) – The unit of the physical_quantity that needs to be placed on the y axis

  • tenpower (int) – The power for scientific notation if 0 scientific notation will not be used

Plotter.Set_zlabel(ax, physical_quantity, unit, tenpower=0)

Method to set the z label on given axis object. When using latex symbols it is required to add $$ only by the unit parameter.

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes) – matplotlib axis object.

  • physical_quantity (str) – The physical_quantity that needs to be placed on the z axis

  • unit (str) – The unit of the physical_quantity that needs to be placed on the z axis

  • tenpower (int) – The power for scientific notation if 0 scientific notation will not be used
